answers.author: Iris Hill
answers.text:
We recently revised our policy at the Town of Edisto Beach to account for billing adjustments.  The language below is how we addressed the issue.
The customer may submit to the town a written challenge to the charges on a utility bill, provided that the challenge is made within 45 days of the date the bill is issued by the town, and further, provided that the customer shall waive his/her right to challenge and be deemed to accept the charges as true and accurate if the customer either pays the bill or does not submit a written challenge within the said 45 days. If it can be determined that the town has overcharged a customer and the customer has not waived his/her right to submit a written challenge as provided herein, the town shall, at the customer's option, credit or refund the excess amount paid by that customer or credit the amount billed

author: Mary Van Milligen
text: The Village of Downers Grove is reviewing our policies on over/under billing for water. Can any municipalities share their policies on refunding over billing and assessing charges for under billing due to errors made by the municipality?
title: Over/Under Billing Policy
